title: [Self-Directed] Representative Learning-Based Curriculum Design for Improving Tennis Serve Technique

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental tennis techniques, match management understanding, and mastery of serve mechanics
context.additional_context: Providing training environments closely resembling actual game situations for learners with fieldwork experience. Establishing a skill diagnostic and feedback system through quantitative data analysis using digital equipment

learning_goals: Learners can improve serve accuracy (landing point) by 20% under conditions resembling actual game situations by applying representational learning design.
Learners can enhance serve angle adjustment skills by 15% across training scenarios with varying representational levels (low/medium/high).
Learners can evaluate interactions between serve speed, position, and strategic choices using digital analysis tools (tracking systems).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
